channel.title: JavaScript on My Hugo
channel.description: Recent content in JavaScript on My Hugo

item.title: Playing Javascript with VisualStudio Code
item.description: Project Configuration SC-P open action menu, type javascript and choose “Go to project configuration” Create/Edit jsconfig.json at the workspace root ${workspaceFolder}/jsconfig.json by defaut it looks like { "compilerOptions": { "module": "commonjs", "target": "es2016", "jsx": "preserve" }, "exclude": [ "node_modules", "**/node_modules/*" ] } Debugging Click Debug icon in #Activity Bar# to activate the Debug view Click gear icon at the top of the Debug view to create/modify launch.json, which locates at ${workspaceFolder}/.

item.title: Access DOM Element In External Resource
item.description: Use Case How do we access DOM elements in external resource, such as <object> or <iframe>? <iframe id="my-frame" src="other-page.html"> </iframe> <object id="my-obj" type="image/svg+xml" data="my-url.svg"> </object> <div>normal DOM elements</div> For example, following is the external my-url.svg <svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"> <rect id="r1" x="10" y="10" width="300" height="200" fill="yellow"/> </svg> The anwser is the property contentDocument of the object/iframe element. var svg_doc = document.getElementById('my-obj').contentDocument var rect = svg_doc.getElementById('r1')
